publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The Wood family papers consist mainly of the legal and financial records of Ebenezer, Ephraim, and Amos W. Wood or Woodville, New York. Included are legal summonses, deeds, bonds, affadavits, land survey materials, accounts, and school records. Among the papers are Amos E. Wood's will and property records deeding his land to his six children; a letter by four different correspondence to Amos Wood while he was on a journey to Ohio in 1836; an 1818 contract for the construction of a schoolhouse, giving the location and dimensions and the amount paid to the carpenter, and a printed proclamation from President Van Buren not to participate in hostilities arising in Canada [1838].

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: The Wood family is considered to one of the first families to settle in what is presently Jefferson County, New York. Amos Wood was the son of Ephraim Wood, who was one of the three brothers after whom the village of Woodville was named. The original name of the village was Wood’s Settlement, which was founded by Ebenezer, Jacob and Ephraim Wood in 1804, and at present lies in the township of Ellisburg.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains legal transactions, survey and land records, bookkeeping accounts and letters produced or received by the Wood family. The more significant pieces of the collection are the letters written by Amos when he visited Ohio in 1836, a contract, including buildling plans for a school house to be built [1818], and a printed proclamation from President Van Buren not to participate in hostilities arising in Canada [1838].

note.p: The papers were found, unarranged, in a wooden box in an attic in Woodville and given to Dr. Charles M. Snyder to be housed in Special Collections.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p: Legal transactions made by members of the Wood family for people in the community (outside family members). Similar materials dealing with the same case have been left in original order.
Legal transactions made by members of the Wood family with others outside of the family.
Surveying and land records made for Wood family members by and with others outside of the family.
Bookkeeping accounts made by Wood family members for themselves and others outside of the family.
All records in the collection for School District no. 14.
One foldout letter including four separate letters to Amos E. Wood from E.C. Wood, R.M. Wood, Simeon T. Wood, Amos F. Wood, and H.D.S. (unidentified) on May 17, 1836.
All documents not able to be classified elsewhere in the collection:

did.unittitle: Family Record of Ephraim Wood’s family on back of bookkeeping account made in 1802 by Amos E. Wood

scopecontent.p: Unidentified records mentioning Enos Eastman, Abiah Jenkins, Luther Jenkins, Abram Farr, Esarlah Doan, Oliver Bachelaor (?), Amos E. Wood, Arhan Burnam, Ebenezer Wood, George Jenkins, James Botter, Samuel Truesdale, Levi Pierce, Orin A. Polly, Jerimiah Wood, Asa Cummins, George Harpham, Benjamin Wilcox, William Colvin, Caleb Tracy, Charlotte Phillips, Christopher Edmons, Jaboza Howard, John Varay, John Miner, and Asa Carpenter.

did.unittitle: Certificate for Amos E. Wood of Participation in the War of 1812
Masonic Membership Certificate of Amos E. Wood
List of supporters for burying ground near Ebenezer Wood’s property
Printed Proclamation by President Martin Van Buren
Printed poem “Strife of Tongues,” by Amos Eastman
Advertising pamphlet for “Dr. Tripps’ Blood Purifier”
Agreement between D. Colvin and A.F. Wood (Amos E.’s son)
